title: 5 ways to boost your immunity without any supplements | The Times of India
description: If you have been looking for ways to boost your immunity, you have landed in the right place.
cleaned_text: boost your immunity without any supplements If you have been looking for ways to boost your immunity, you have landed in the right place. In this article, we will tell you five easy ways to boost your immunity which does not involve gathering various ingredients for kadha or drinking other not so delicious drinks. Immunity has been one of the top searched keywords in the past year. This is because keeping our immunity strong is one of our best bets to fight the novel coronavirus. While we all now know how kadhas, fruits, and giloy can boost our immunity. Here are 5 simple ways to boost your immunity. Your immune system needs more than just the right kind of foods to thrive and work efficiently. Your simple lifestyle habits can optimise the functioning of your immune system. [readmore](javascript://) 02/6Get adequate sleep Getting enough sleep is one of the basic steps towards healthy living. Yes, sleep can affect your immunity. According to a study published in the Journal of Experimental Medicine, a good night's sleep can help the T-cells function better. T cells are responsible for killing infected cells in the body and regulating the immune response. When you sleep, the adrenaline and prostaglandin hormones are low in the body. These hormones keep the T-cells from doing their job. Studies have found that people who sleep better have a better immune response than people who do not get enough sleep. [readmore](javascript://) 03/6Say NO to alcohol In these tough times, a glass of alcohol may feel like your true companion, which is not true. A glass of alcohol can actually spell doom for immunity. It reduces the body's capacity to fight off infections. Thus, one must limit their drinking to keep their immune system in shape. [readmore](javascript://) 04/6Quit smoking COVID virus is a respiratory disease and smoking too affects our lungs. Smoking puts the health of your lungs in danger and thus must be avoided to keep your lungs healthy and immune system in shape. Smoking disrupts the balance of the immune system and reduces the body's ability to fight off infections. [readmore](javascript://) 05/6Keep your stress levels in check Stress can wreak havoc in our system. Even if you are eating right, sleeping enough, not smoking or drinking, stress still can be a villain in your life, which reduces your body's ability to beat infections. When we are stressed, our body releases cortisol hormone as a part of its natural fight or flight response to help one deal with the situation. High levels of cortisol in the body can hamper the overall system. Stressing too much over something can hamper your immunity and thus your health. So, if you find yourself constantly stressed, you must try some stress management techniques to tackle it. [readmore](javascript://) 06/6Stay physically active As per studies, people who exercise tend to produce more T-cells than people who do not exercise. According to a 2019 study published in the Journal of Sports and Health Science, every time you engage in moderate exercise, your body's natural defence system enhances.
